This move allows Blackstone to nominate a director to the bank's board. In a separate decision, CCI cleared Tata Steel's acquisition of full control over Tata BlueScope Steel.

items.title: HMEL to invest Rs 2,600 cr in Bathinda refinery expansion
items.summary: HPCL Mittal Energy Limited will invest Rs 2,600 crore to expand its Bathinda refinery. New polypropylene downstream units and fine chemical projects are planned. This expansion aims to boost industrial growth in Punjab. The refinery is already a key polypropylene manufacturing hub. The investment is expected to create more jobs and strengthen Punjab's industrial ecosystem.

items.title: Health push makes nutraceuticals India’s fastest-growing consumer segment, says Earthful
items.summary: Earthful, a plant-based consumer brand, is launching a community initiative to raise menopause awareness in India, offering stipends to women over 40 to lead local and digital conversations. This move comes as India's nutraceuticals market, driven by rising health consciousness and plant-based demand, experiences rapid growth, with Earthful aiming to empower women through this initiative.

items.title: Rubber Research Institute develop latex based paint
items.summary: The technology was developed by the Rubber Products Incubation Centre (RPIC) of the Rubber Research Institute of India (RRII)

items.title: Prestige Estates buys 25-acre land in Chennai to build Rs 5K cr worth housing project
items.summary: The company has acquired the land parcel in Medavakkam, Chennai. "The acquired land parcel offers a development potential of approximately 5 million square feet, with an estimated top-line revenue potential of over Rs 5,000 crore," Prestige Estates said in a regulatory filing.

items.title: RBI doubles liquidity push with  ₹2 trillion OMO, $10 billion dollar-rupee swap
items.summary: The central bank has announced a second round of liquidity measures after December’s move fell short of market expectations, as tight money conditions and rupee weakness persist.

items.title: Anicut Capital announces final close of ₹1,275-crore third private credit fund
items.summary: Anicut Capital’s total assets under management (AUM) stand at roughly ₹4,500 crore across debt and equity strategies.

items.summary: Mint unpacks how the store functions, whether Swiggy Instamart stands to gain meaningfully, and what this could mean for quick commerce.

items.title: Govt proposes double sided closed auction as bidding mechanism for Coal Exchange
items.summary: The proposal forms part of the revised draft Coal Exchange Rules, 2025

items.title: Budget 2026: Highways that shape India’s next decade
items.summary: Budget 2026 is poised to prioritize infrastructure spending, particularly on roads and rural development, as a key driver for sustained economic growth amidst global trade tensions and domestic employment concerns. This strategic focus aims to bolster public investment, enhance logistics, and foster inclusive development as India pursues its long-term vision.

items.title: 8th Pay Commission from January 1, 2026? Why central employees may not see higher pay till 2028
items.summary: The 8th Pay Commission is due from January 1, 2026, marking the end of the 7th Pay Commission cycle. However, experts say revised salaries may only be implemented around 2028 after the panel submits its report and the government clears the recommendations. A fitment factor of around 1.92 is seen as the most practical, which could raise the minimum basic pay from Rs 18,000 to about Rs 34,560. Dearness Allowance, likely to be around 60 to 65 per cent by 2026, will be adjusted into the new pay and then reset to zero. Employees can also expect arrears for the delay period, making the eventual payo

items.title: Radico Khaitan launches Kohinoor Reserve Indian Dark Rum in home market — Check prices in Delhi, Karnataka, UP
items.summary: Radico Khaitan launched its premium segment, Kohinoor Reserve Indian Dark Rum, in the home market after a successful debut on the global front. Here are the prices for customers in Delhi, Karnataka, and Uttar Pradesh.&nbsp;

items.title: Tariffs impacts: Indian leather exporters incurring business losses in US, staring at sharp decline in shipments
items.summary: Indian leather exporters face significant losses and declining shipments to the US due to steep tariffs, risking layoffs and market share.

items.title: Over 4,500 Industrial Parks playing key role in India's big push for growth
items.summary: There are currently 306 plug-and-play industrial parks in India, and an additional 20 plug-and-play industrial parks and smart cities are being developed under the National Industrial Corridor Development Corporation (NICDC).

items.title: Hyundai drives into cricket, inks global partnership with ICC for 2026–27 tournaments
items.summary: Hyundai Motor Company has announced a global partnership with the International Cricket Council (ICC) for its tournaments from 2026 to 2027. As a premier partner, Hyundai secures exclusive rights for major events like the Men's Cricket World Cup 2027, aiming to connect with over two billion fans worldwide.

items.title: Bird flu outbreak confirmed in parts of Alappuzha, Kottayam
items.summary: In Kottayam, the disease has been detected in the villages of Kuruppanthara, Manjoor, Kallupurakkal and Velur. Quails and chickens were among the birds found to be infected

items.title: Ambuja Cements merger plans will lead to fall in promoters holding
items.summary: The merger will lead to an equity dilution of 12 per cent for Ambuja Cements post-amalgamation of all the group companies

items.title: Indigo cancels 50 flights at various airports on Tuesday
items.summary: IndiGo cancelled about 50 flights on Tuesday. This comes as the airline faces a government probe for massive operational disruptions. Thousands of flights were cancelled earlier, causing hardship to passengers. The Directorate General of Civil Aviation is investigating IndiGo's pilot rostering and preparedness. The probe panel has questioned top officials. A report is expected this week.

items.title: From Air India crash to IndiGo meltdown, 5 events that defined Indian aviation in 2025
items.summary: The year started on a high note, and the Kumbh Mela was on the horizon. Airlines were adding flights to Prayagraj and the January-March quarter was a magic one. However, the way things started shaping up since then made this year a year to forget for Indian aviation.

items.title: Adani Ports completes acquisition of NQXT Australia
items.summary: As part of the transaction, APSEZ allotted over 14.38 crore equity shares to Carmichael Rail and Port Singapore Holdings on a preferential basis

items.title: 'Bitcoin not as attractive as gold...': Ray Dalio explains why he is cautious on world's biggest crypto
items.summary: Ray Dalio asserts that gold is superior to Bitcoin due to its immunity from government control and potential risks associated with Bitcoin, including interference and monitoring. He recommends a 5-15% allocation to gold, expressing concerns about stablecoins and the volatility of fiat currencies.

items.title: Adani Ports and Special Economic Zone completes NQXT Australia acquisition to boost global port footprint
items.summary: Adani Ports has acquired NQXT Australia. This move boosts its international operations and cargo handling goals. The deal received necessary approvals. NQXT is expected to contribute significantly to Adani Ports' future earnings. The Australian terminal offers strong EBITDA margins and stable cash flows. Adani Ports plans to expand NQXT's capacity. This acquisition enhances its position in global trade routes.

items.title: China files complaint in WTO against India's measures for solar, IT sectorgoods
items.summary: "China ​said the measures ​in question include ‌India's tariff ‍treatment and certain ‍measures that China said are contingent ‌upon the use of domestic inputs and otherwise discriminate against Chinese imports," the WTO said in ‍a statement.

items.title: Japan’s M&A deals boom, the global China+1 strategy, and why India is the big winner
items.summary: Japan's M&amp;A deals have risen 54% to some $359 billion so far in 2025—part of it explaining the strong dealmaking in India by Japanese investors. This reflects Japan's shift towards India amidst geopolitical uncertainties with China, experts said.

items.title: NTA to introduce facial biometric verification, live photography in major entrance exams from 2026
items.summary: The National Testing Agency (NTA) will implement facial biometric authentication and live photography for all entrance exams, starting with JEE (Mains) in January 2026. These measures, recommended by the Radhakrishnan Committee, aim to curb impersonation and malpractices by ensuring real-time identity verification at multiple stages of the examination process.

items.title: Ajanta Pharma ties up with Biocon to sell generic semaglutide in overseas market
items.summary: Ajanta Pharma plans to sell generic semaglutide in 26 countries, in a partnership with Biocon, capitalizing on patent expirations. With a strong foothold in emerging markets and a potential 10x market growth, Ajanta aims to become a leading player in the global GLP-1 market by 2027.

items.title: India’s first indigenous water-soluble fertilizer pilot plant launched in Nagpur
items.summary: Supported by JNARDDC-funded research, the facility was completed nearly a month ahead of schedule

items.title: A nervous bond market prepares for a new year. What to expect.
items.summary: Fed independence and inflation will define the outlook.

items.title: Union Bank of India cuts interest rates on select retail loan products by 30-160 bps
items.summary: Home loan interest rates have been reduced by 30 bps, and start at 7.15%, as against the earlier rate of 7.45% p.a.

items.title: Why Shree Cement’s H.M. Bangur is sitting out of India’s aggressive cement bidding wars
items.summary: In a rare interview, Shree Cement’s H.M. Bangur, a shrewd strategist, talks of organic growth, efficiency over size, and the 6 AM decision that saved his company from a total sell-off.

items.title: How US Fed policy and rupee swings could shape FPI flows into Indian bond market
items.summary: As long as India’s growth engine stays strong and inflation behaves, foreign investors continue to earn well for holding Indian debt. In short, the Fed isn’t taking away India’s yield advantage anytime soon.

items.title: Industry consultations on mandatory labelling of AI-generated content over, rules soon: IT Secy
items.summary: New Delhi is set to release rules for mandatory AI-generated content labelling. The government has consulted with the industry, which has shown understanding and minimal pushback. Key feedback focuses on clarifying what constitutes a significant AI modification versus routine enhancements. These rules aim to ensure citizens know if content is synthetic or authentic, addressing concerns about deepfakes and misinformation.

items.title: Admach Systems IPO Day 1: Latest GMP, subscription status, listing date & other details about  ₹42 crore issue
items.summary: Admach Systems' IPO opened today with low investor interest, being subscribed only 0.03 times. The company aims to raise  ₹42.60 crore through a price band of  ₹227-239 per share, with minimum investment of  ₹2.86 lakh for retail investors.

items.summary: Snapping two-day gaining streak, 30-share BSE Sensex dipped 42.64 points or 0.05% to settle at 85,524.84. During the day, it hit a high of 85,704.93 and a low of 85,342.99

items.title: 2025: The year RBI used the chopper
items.summary: The RBI ended 2025 with its most aggressive pro-growth shift in six years, cutting interest rates four times for a cumulative 125 basis points, bringing the repo rate down from 6.50% to 5.25%. Under Governor Sanjay Malhotra, the central bank pivoted decisively toward growth, supported by record-low inflation and strong GDP expansion above 8% in mid-2025.

items.title: Biocon Biologics gets global rights for biosimilar Adalimumab
items.summary: Biocon Biologics has gained complete global rights for Hulio, a biosimilar Adalimumab. This move grants Biocon Biologics full control over manufacturing and commercialization. The company aims to expand affordable access to high-quality biologics for patients with inflammatory diseases worldwide. This strategic acquisition enhances flexibility and cost efficiency for Biocon Biologics.

items.title: HDFC Bank spends Rs 1,068 crore in CSR during FY25
items.summary: HDFC Bank has significantly boosted its CSR spending, investing Rs 1,068.03 crore in 2024-25, a Rs 123 crore increase.  Over a decade, its 'Parivartan' initiative has positively impacted over 10.5 crore lives across India, focusing on inclusive and sustainable development in key areas like rural upliftment and financial inclusion.

items.summary: The target is to expand the charging infrastructure to 10 lakh charging points, including 1 lakh public charging points by 2030

items.summary: The move, similar to benefits earlier extended to the European Union, will enable protection for a wide range of Indian agricultural, handicraft and industrial products.

items.summary: The regulator has cut gas transport zones and imposed a uniform tariff that aims to reduce regional disparities and boost natural gas adoption.

items.title: Stocks to buy for long term: M&M, ICICI Pru among Religare Broking's 5 high-conviction stock picks for 2026

items.title: Govt to tap e-tailers, online sources for price data in new CPI series
items.summary: The government plans to include online and e-commerce price data in calculating retail inflation (CPI) to improve its accuracy, reliability and relevance. As part of a broader statistical overhaul, the Ministry of Statistics and Programme Implementation (MoSPI) is revising the base years for CPI, GDP and the Index of Industrial Production (IIP).

items.title: Budget 2026-27 to back domestic demand as exports stay weak: EY
items.summary: While income tax and GST reforms may lead to some revenue sacrifice in the current fiscal, additional non-tax receipts and lower revenue expenditure could help meet fiscal deficit and capex targets.

items.title: AI training methods do not violate our copyright law—but the output that AI models generate might
items.summary: Is AI walking all over our copyright law? Learning from material under copyright is not the same as copying it, as courts have long established. While AI training may be legal, the output of GenAI models may not be—this is what we must watch for violations.

items.title: Shree Cement withdraws lockout at Baloda Bazar plant in Raipur
items.summary: Shree Cement has ended its lockout at the Baloda Bazar plant in Raipur, Chhattisgarh. The company and its workers reached an amicable settlement. The lockout was imposed due to non-cooperation from workmen. This action is now withdrawn. The plant's operations will resume. No damage to company property was reported during the lockout period.

items.title: Jos Alukkas welcomes Dulquer Salmaan as brand ambassador
items.summary: The association with Dulquer Salman comes at a time when the group is expanding its presence to a wider, more contemporary audience

items.summary: The PepsiCo bottler’s  ₹1,120-crore acquisition of South Africa’s Twizza signals a strategic shift toward slower-burn scale overseas as competition crimps margin headroom at home.

items.summary: The order has been placed by a leading solar EPC (engineering procurement construction) company

items.summary: Corporate misgovernance allegations were levelled against some of the companies of the Murugappa Group by the Cobrapost website

items.title: Adani clean energy arms see milestone year with scale-up in solar, wind, green hydrogen
items.summary: Adani Group's clean energy ventures achieved significant milestones in 2025, with Adani Solar reaching 15,000 MW module shipments and Adani Wind surpassing 1 GW of onshore turbine installations. The conglomerate also commissioned India's first off-grid 5 MW green hydrogen pilot plant, underscoring its growing role in the global energy transition.

items.title: Silver is today’s new small-cap, says Edelweiss Mutual Fund MD & CEO Radhika Gupta
items.summary: Gupta says this momentum mirrors the kind of enthusiasm small-cap equities saw in the previous market cycle as it transitions from a niche investment to a mainstream portfolio component

items.summary: Waaree Transpower has secured a significant Rs 100 crore order for 1.27 gigawatt transformers. This major milestone was achieved within the first month of the company's launch. The transformers will be deployed for utility-scale solar projects across various states. This development highlights Waaree Transpower's growing presence in the renewable energy sector.

items.title: Quick commerce, BFSI, e-commerce lead hiring demand in 2025: Report
items.summary: According to Apna.co report, SMBs accounted for 10 lakh job postings during the year, compared with 4 lakh from large enterprises, creating a more geographically distributed hiring landscape beyond major metros

items.summary: Multibagger stock: Godawari Power and Ispat share price surged more than 7% during the market session on Tuesday, despite mixed market trends on the Indian stock market. Godawari Power stock hit its intraday high level of  ₹260.10. Here's what you need to know.

items.summary: The Sensex ended with a minor loss of 43 points, or 0.05%, at 85,524.84, while the Nifty 50 closed 5 points, or 0.02%, up at 26,177.15. The BSE Midcap index inched up by 0.07%, and the Smallcap index rose by 0.38%.

items.summary: POWERCON will undertake a comprehensive technical health assessment of the turbines and associated infrastructure

items.summary: The EGM approval marks a significant step in PRISM’s ongoing preparations for a public listing

items.summary: Customers can now get their vehicles serviced within the same day, without paying anything extra, while experiencing a fully digital and transparent service journey end-to-end, the Bengaluru-based firm said

items.title: Kauvery Hospital strengthens digital backbone ahead of IPO plans
items.summary: Kauvery Hospital has launched a one-tap ‘SOS’ emergency feature on its Kauvery KARE app, enabling GPS-based ambulance dispatch and 24/7 doctor video access

items.title: Podcast listeners surge in India, but ad revenue lags behind
items.summary: Podcasting in India is growing, with 177 mn monthly listeners in 2024, projected to reach 267 mn by 2029. Despite this growth, ad revenue remains low, and discovery challenges persist, especially for non-celebrity podcasts. YouTube's rise as a platform is influencing podcast consumption habits.

items.title: Tata Motors to roll out five new EVs by FY30; eyes leadership in segment
items.summary: Tata Motors plans to launch five new electric vehicle models by fiscal year 2030. This includes the premium Avinya range. The company will invest between Rs 16,000 to Rs 18,000 crore in its electric vehicle business. This investment will support new products and expand charging infrastructure.

items.title: Credit Card issuance declines in Q2FY26 amid slowing consumer credit growth: JM Financial
items.summary: The number of new credit cards issued fell to 4.4 million in the second quarter of FY26, a steep 28% year-on-year decline compared with 6.1 million cards issued in the same period last year

items.title: Pot luck: How Trump’s move to liberalize cannabis use could reshape America’s marijuana industry
items.summary: Reclassifying marijuana as just another drug—instead of a dangerous one—won’t legalize weed everywhere in the US, but it acknowledges market reality and may set the stage for both deeper research of its effects and a commercial boom.

items.title: Jumpstarting wind energy: Govt plans new blueprint to put the wind back in the sails of the sector
items.summary: The Union government aims to revive India's wind power sector by addressing grid connectivity, land acquisition, and unsigned power purchase agreements. A task force will tackle these issues to achieve 100 GW capacity by 2030.

items.title: Leasing of retail spaces in malls, high streets up 15 per cent this year on better demand-supply: C&W
items.summary: Retail space leasing in India's major cities is set for a significant jump in 2025. Nearly 9 million square feet of space is expected to be leased, marking the highest activity since the pandemic. This surge is fueled by new mall supply and strong retailer demand. Consumers are increasingly favoring experience-led retail and lifestyle destinations.

items.title: Mangalam group to invest Rs 1,000 crore to expand hospitality portfolio
items.summary: Manglam Group is investing Rs 1,000 crore in hospitality. Their first project, The Westin Jaipur Kant Kalwar Resort & Spa, has opened. This marks a significant step for the developer. The group is also developing serviced apart-otel units. Two more hospitality projects are in planning. These ventures aim to cater to leisure and business travelers.

items.title: Samsung Electronics unit Harman to acquire ZF Group's ADAS business for $1.8 billion
items.summary: Samsung said the deal will allow Harman to secure ADAS-related technologies and products, ​including front-facing vehicle cameras and ADAS ⁠controllers, marking a full-scale entry into the fast-growing ADAS market

items.title: Budget 2026: A close look at India's infrastructure output within a year before Sitharaman sets the ball rolling in Lok Sabha
items.summary: As we near Budget 2026, the spotlight shifts to infrastructure development and its vital link to economic expansion. While the core sectors present a mixed bag of results, the overall GDP continues to demonstrate resilience. It's the surge in private investment and manufacturing that propels growth forward.

items.title: Bankers urge RBI action as rupee forward premiums hit multi-year highs
items.summary: Outsized moves ​in the forward market intensified over the last week as the ‌dollar glut collided with regulatory and balance-sheet constraints, leading to a ​spike in premiums

items.title: Under 5 pc of disease-focussed genomic studies conducted in low, middle-income countries: WHO
items.summary: A World Health Organization analysis reveals over 80% of global genomic disease studies are in high-income countries, with under 5% in low and middle-income nations. This geographic disparity, alongside a focus on non-infectious diseases, highlights a missed opportunity to address global health priorities and promote health equity.

items.title: Noida International Airport partners with Tech Mahindra for network, cybersecurity operations
items.summary: As part of the collaboration, Tech Mahindra will deliver round-the-clock monitoring and management of network and security operations for the airport’s critical IT infrastructure

items.title: Noida International Airport partners with Tech Mahindra for network, cybersecurity operations
items.summary: Tech Mahindra will collaborate with NIA to establish a robust, process-driven ecosystem that places cybersecurity at the heart of airport operations, ensuring a reliable, secure, and scalable technology framework from the very beginning.

items.title: Credit Card issuance declines in Q2FY26 amid slowing consumer credit growth: JM Financial
items.summary: India's credit card growth is slowing. New card issuances have dropped significantly. Private banks are increasing their market share in credit cards. Meanwhile, public sector banks are gaining ground in personal, home, and auto loans. This shift indicates evolving trends in consumer credit across different banking sectors.

items.title: New Zealand's McClay bets on $20 bn India play as Delhi, Wellington seal FTA
items.summary: India and New Zealand have signed a free trade agreement, aiming to boost private sector investment in India by $20 billion over 15 years. The pact offers New Zealand companies enhanced opportunities in sectors like food manufacturing and engineering, while India secures zero-duty access for all its exports.

items.title: Dark to bright stores? What's Instamart's offline experiment?
items.summary: Swiggy’s Instamart  opened its first physical “experience store” in Gurugram, marking a first in India’s quick commerce sector. Unlike conventional retail or dark stores, the outlet focuses on sensory engagement—letting customers touch and assess select categories like fresh produce and private-label products.

items.title: India will continue to encourage tourism traffic to support Sri Lanka, says Jaishankar
items.summary: "There are other ways by which India can and will be of support to Sri Lanka. You are a significant tourism economy and let me assure you that we will continue to encourage tourism traffic from India in that regard," Jaishankar said, speaking alongside Sri Lanka's Foreign Minister Vijitha Herath in Colombo.

items.title: HCLTech’s software arm to acquire Antwerp-based startup Wobby for $5.2 million
items.summary: Wobby provides AI data analyst ‘Agents’ that enable users to query complex datasets through a natural language interface and receive actionable insights instantly

items.title: Nisus Finance acquires residential tower in Dubai Motor City for Rs 536 cr

This acquisition includes the asset, transaction expenses, and refurbishment. The completed building features 273 apartments. This move expands Nisus Finance's international real estate portfolio and strengthens its presence in the Middle East.

items.title: Mint Explainer | Why Adani is folding its cement assets into Ambuja now
items.summary: The merger follows a rapid acquisition spree since 2022 and aims to streamline operations, cut costs and create a single pan-India cement platform under Ambuja Cements.

The port welcomed tourists with cultural displays. Special facilities were arranged for visitors. Tourists explored local attractions, experiencing the region's heritage. The port expects more cruise ship requests for the season.

items.title: Watch: Explained: What are Supplementary Demands for Grants?

So, in December, it submits what is known as a Supplementary Demand for Grants if it needs more money.
